definition: to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
to expel/to urge on/to drive/to run quickly
old variant of 驅|驱[qu1]
variant of 驅|驱[qu1]
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: In the fourth quarter he routinely posted up and burst past Kevin Garnett to finish at the rim.
sentences.chinese: 在第四节，他长驱直入，隔着加内特在篮筐上暴扣。

sentences.english: The army fought its way down and captured many enemy camps.
sentences.chinese: 这支部队长驱直入，攻下了许多敌军军营。

sentences.english: With the Macedonian cavalry engaged on both flanks, Alexander sends his phalanxes straight into the center of the Persian lines.
sentences.chinese: 亚历山大派遣方阵，长驱直入波斯军阵列的中央。

sentences.english: The Allied troops are advancing on the camp of the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这支部队长驱直入，攻下了许多敌军军营。

sentences.english: Hong Kong has no such natural protection from a flood of Hollywood production.
sentences.chinese: 香港没有这种天然的保护来阻挡好莱坞影片长驱直入。

sentences.english: Tanks are now allowed to drive right up next to some of the woodpecker colonies.
sentences.chinese: 现在坦克已经允许长驱直入到啄木鸟的家园附近。

definition: to storm/to attack directly
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
to overcome/to take (a fortress)/to fall (to an attack)/to surrender
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
in command of the army
to attack violently/to storm
to make a breakthrough/to break through/to breach (military)
to invade
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to knock at the gate (old)/to make an approach/to invade/to attack the goal (sports)
to defeat/to smash/to rout
to sally/to attack
to attack and seize
